basic.description: This course is the first course required for biochemistry majors; it is also recommended for other majors who intend to study advanced biochemistry. Topics covered include protein structure, protein function, membranes, enzyme catalysis, bioenergetics, carbohydrate metabolism, and lipid metabolism. This lecture-based course meets three hours a week.
basic.subject: BCH
basic.title: General Biochemistry I

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: CHM 2210 with a grade of "C-" or better. Corequisite: CHM 2211.
